news.title: Nvidia set to launch new chip that could reset the AI race, says report — Key things to know
news.description: Nvidia is in the process of designing a new system for “inference” computing. This will allow the company's customers and their AI models to respond to queries, as per WSJ. This will make the work of companies like OpenAI easier.

news.title: Nvidia plans new chip to speed AI processing: WSJ
news.description: Nvidia plans to launch a new processor to help OpenAI and other clients run AI systems faster and more efficiently. The chip is for “inference” computing and will debut at Nvidia’s GTC conference. It incorporates a design by startup Groq.

news.title: Pentagon Designates Anthropic Supply Chain Risk Over AI Military Dispute
news.description:
Anthropic on Friday hit back after U.S. Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth directed the Pentagon to designate the artificial intelligence (AI) upstart as a "supply chain risk."
"This action follows months of negotiations that reached an impasse over two except…

news.title: OpenAI strikes deal with Pentagon hours after Trump admin bans Anthropic | CNN Business
news.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman announced late Friday that the company had signed a deal with the Pentagon for its AI tools to be used in the military’s classified systems, but with seemingly similar guardrails rival Anthropic had also requested.

news.title: Trump orders US govt to stop using Anthropic AI tech
news.description: US President Donald Trump told the US government to "immediately" stop using Anthropic's technology after the AI start-up rejected the Pentagon's demand that it agree to unconditional military use of its Claude models.

news.title: OpenAI gets $110 billion in funding from a trio of tech powerhouses, led by Amazon
news.description: OpenAI secures $110 billion in funding from Amazon, Nvidia, and SoftBank, enhancing its AI capabilities and global reach.

news.title: Altman says agreement reached with Pentagon to deploy OpenAI models for classified work—Did Anthropic refusal clear way?
news.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman today announced the company has reached an agreement with the Pentagon to deploy its models in classified networks. This comes amid the department's spat with Anthropic over “full military use” of its AI models.

news.title: Former Trump AI Adviser Torches President’s War on Anthropic: ‘Attempted Corporate Murder’
news.description:
A former senior artificial intelligence adviser to President Donald Trump lambasted the president's treatment of Anthropic for failing to cave to the president's demands.
The post Former Trump AI Adviser Torches President’s War on Anthropic: ‘Attempted Corpor…

news.title: ChatGPT crosses 900 million weekly users, 50 million paying subscribers
news.description: Per Turley, for many users, ChatGPT is their entry point into AI. They start with writing, building, doing research, planning trips, shopping, or getting tasks done. Turley added that as the number of people using ChatGPT rises, the system learns faster, resu…

news.title: A pledge for power, but a thirst unquenched: Tech’s data center dilemma
news.description: Major tech companies will meet with President Trump at the White House next week to sign a “Rate Payer Protection Pledge.” The pledge commits companies to providing their own power for new AI data centers to prevent rising electricity bills for nearby consume…

news.title: OpenAI strikes a deal with the Defense Department to deploy its AI models
news.description: OpenAI has reached an agreement with the Defense Department to deploy its models in the agency’s network, company chief Sam Altman has revealed on X. In his post, he said two of OpenAI’s most important safety principles are “prohibitions on domestic mass surv…

news.title: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei calls White House's actions "retaliatory and punitive"
news.description: Hours before Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei's interview, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth deemed the AI company a "supply chain risk to national security," which restricts military contractors from doing business with Anthropic.

news.title: Trump orders immediate halt to government use of Anthropic: Six-month termination of contracts and threats of “criminal consequences”
news.description:

news.description: Anthropic CEO Dario Amodei sat down with CBS News for an exclusive interview, hours after Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth declared the company a supply chain risk to national security, which restricts military contractors from doing business with the AI giant.…

news.title: OpenAI gives Pentagon access to models after Anthropic dustup
news.description: The startup also built safeguards to ensure its models behave as they should as part of the deployment, Altman said in a post on the social media platform X

news.title: Anthropic hack puts IT stock pack on slide row in February; Nifty IT's 19% fall worst since 2008 crisis
news.description: The Nifty IT index plunged 19.5% in February, its steepest monthly drop since 2008, as AI disruption fears and new tools from Anthropic triggered heavy selling. Tech stocks erased Rs 5.7 lakh crore in market value, with Coforge and LTIMindtree among the worst…

news.title: OpenAI strikes deal with Pentagon, hours after rival Anthropic was blacklisted by Trump
news.description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman said on X that his company has come to terms with the Defense Department for use of its models.

news.title: Anthropic Hits Back After US Military Labels It a 'Supply Chain Risk'
news.description: Anthropic says it would be “legally unsound” for the Pentagon to blacklist its technology after talks over military use of its artificial intelligence models broke down.

news.title: Anthropic calls Pentagon's supply chain risk tag 'unprecedented', vows to challenge in court
news.description: The company argued that current frontier AI models are "not reliable enough" for fully autonomous weapons and warned that such use could endanger US troops and civilians.

clusters.title: Tech Industry Developments
